Package org.forgerock.openidm.provisioner

Interface ProvisionerService

All Known Implementing Classes:
OpenICFProvisionerService
public interface ProvisionerService
Minimum behavior for a provisioner used to provision resources to external sources.

  • Method Details

    • getSystemIdentifier

      SystemIdentifier getSystemIdentifier()
      Gets the unique SystemIdentifier of this instance.

      The service which refers to this service instance can distinguish between multiple instances by this value.

      Returns:
      the provisioner's system identifier

    • liveSynchronize

      org.forgerock.json.JsonValue liveSynchronize(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context, String objectType, org.forgerock.json.JsonValue previousStage) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Synchronise the changes from the end system for the given objectType.

      OpenIDM takes active role in the synchronisation process by asking the end system to get all changed object. Not all systems are capable to fulfill this kind of request but if the end system is capable then the implementation sends each change to a new request on the router and when it is finished, it returns a new stage object.

      The previousStage object is the previously returned value of this method. Unhandled exception will result not to update the stage object in repository.

      All exceptions must be handled to save the the new stage object.

      Parameters:
      context - the request context associated with the invocation
      objectType -
      previousStage - The previously returned object. If null then it's the first execution.
      Returns:
      The new updated stage object. This will be the previousStage at next call.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException - if a failure occurred during live sync
